Dear all

The State and University Library of Denmark and The Royal Library of Denmark are pleased to announce the release of the NetarchiveSuite as 
Open Source. The source code, documentation and other information, including a quick start manual are available from http://netarchive.dk/suite


About the NetarchiveSuite
The NetarchiveSuite is the complete web archiving software package developed within the netarchive.dk project from 2004 and onwards.
The primary function of the NetarchiveSuite is to plan, schedule and run web harvests of parts of the Internet. It scales to a wide range of 
tasks, from small, thematic harvests (e.g. related to special events, or special domains) to harvesting and archiving the content of an 
entire national domain.
The software has built-in bit preservation functionality.
The systems architecture allows for the software to be distributed among several machines, possibly on more than one geographical location.
The NetarchiveSuite is built around the Heritrix web crawler, which is fundamental for the NetarchiveSuite behavior in harvests of the web.
You find more overview information on the NetarchiveSuite website.


How to see and evaluate the NetarchiveSuite
To see and evaluate the software in a simple setup, you can register and follow the Quick Start Manual. This manual contains all needed 
information to get a simple test system up and running on a standard linux machine.


About libraries behind the NetarchiveSuite
The State and University Library of Denmark and The Royal Library of Denmark is responsible for collecting and archiving material 
encompassed by legal deposit legislation in Denmark. The oldest law on legal deposit legislation in Denmark is from 1697. The latest 
revision of the law is from 2004. This extended the material encompassed by the law to include the Danish Internet as well.


Important links related to the NetarchiveSuite:
Website: http://netarchive.dk/suite
Netarchive Team: webarkivering-teknik@...
Workshop 6th-7th Sep. 2007: http://netarchive.dk/suite/WS_sep_2007


PS: Sorry for cross posting.


Best regards
